job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in Wilmington, OH
pros: They all treat you like family
cons: The pay is to low

pros: Small hospital in a rural town. Friendly staff and great people to work with! Benefits are nice and insurance is decent.
cons: Pay.. CMH won't compete with the big hospitals around. They lose people for this reason or can't get people.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Wilmington, OH
pros: Work family...if you are in the clique.
cons: Management doesn't listen, high turn over. No standards for nurses,wouldn't let my family go here.

review_title: Not a terrible place to work
pros: Left alone to do your work independently
cons: Pay raises were far and few

pros: There is never a shortage of work. Always something to clean. Never a chance a getting laid off or a cut in hours. Bonuses have been given to us to thank us for our good work. Incentive pay has also been given to all employees in our department.
cons: We are so short handed. Our pay is lower than alot of other places that are not in healthcare. People get hired on and only stay a short time and quit. Alot of our areas that we used to clean have been given to outside contactors. Management never seems to listen to our concerns. You feel ignored alot of times. There are several other things but not enough space to put them down.

pros: Small town work environment and good doctors.
cons: Lots off turn over off management positions.

pros:
Always hours available
Decent benefits
cons:
Outdated building and equipment
Management

pros: Great leadership and environment, highly recommend.
cons: Beginning pay but I think that was my lack of negotiating experience.

pros: Great coworkers to work with
cons: Pay could be higher to match other hospitals

pros: Frontline staff and many leaders are wonderful
cons: Some leaders are trouble-makers and the CEO is very immature and hateful

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Wilmington, OH
pros: Pay was not bad but you earn it
cons: Short staffed, poor management, Only about the money

pros: Plenty of room for operations.
cons: Management is extremely poor, with high turnover at all levels.

pros: Good coworkers, food, gift shop, Dr's
cons: get bumped from days i picked up to work sometimes

pros: close to home and took little time to get to and from work.
cons: The hospital was failing financially due to poor administrative occurrences and was looking for a corporation to buy them out of debt and take them over, so we were understaffed, overworked, underpaid, had to use PTO to pay our own wages and therefore couldn't take vacation time unless we could afford not to be paid.  It wasn't a good time to work there.  I left within 2 years.

job_title: REGISTERED MEDICAL ASSISTANT Float in New Port Richey, FL
pros: This company has a great atmosphere and of the offices offer a fun and friendly work environment where other workers offer their knowledge to help you grow.  The offices offer team work and everyone is good on taking accountability for their own actions.
cons: Being a float for several different offices makes it challenging and unless you are completely experienced, where you have your skills as a medical assistant down, I would not recommend a float position.  It is more challenging to sharpen your skills when you float from place to place, rather than staying stationary.

pros: Front line staff are dedicated to the community.  the facility is also in good shape for the it's age.  The ER has made large improvements to serve the community.
cons: CMH Regional health system does not know how to communicate with it's employees.  Things are dictated to the hospital in a one direction fashion without receiving feedback from the front line workers.

review_title: Clinton memorial all downhill after being bought out
pros: Nice location  and safe area. not like working in City hospital.  Was clean and well groomed in past.
cons: Was county owned hospital and then sold out to become private and went downhill from there with major slashing of all good aspects of the hospital. Poor quality of care.  Management disregard for state and federal regulations unbelievable.

pros: Small home town feel. Everyone knows one another. Small department.
cons: Financial hardship the hospital has and still facing.

pros: I get to enjoy seeing different people and enjoy helping them in any way I can
cons: Better staffing  in the department.

pros: Great community, great patients, great doctor
cons: Not valued, negative atmosphere , money hungry
